DEVELOPER

WORK

  • Black & White

    In this project I experimented with responsive layouts to make a website that looks great on any size of screen. In the CSS I sized elements in percentages so they scale as the screen is resized, and repositioning them to improve the flow on smaller screens. I used Javascript to create the Category drop-down mechanic. Black & White is based on a PSD file of a UI kit for a personal blog.
    Link: sarahs.website/blackwhite

  • Ghost Bytes Media

    This was a freelance project to build a website that showcases the work of Ghost Bites Media. Currently in it's initial stages, the site is a branded holding page for the full site. Responsive, mobile friendly, and with subtle interactive elements.
    Link: ghostbytesmedia.com

  • Cherrycoma

    This is my personal blog, an online journal where I jot down my thoughts about my favourite things. The site was developed using Wordpress as the Content Management System. I used PHP to pull content from the back-end, and then used CSS to style it as a responsive site. I also integrated Pinterest, Disqus and share button plugins.
    Link: cherrycoma.co.uk

  • CodePen

    I find Codepen a really useful "login-and-go" environment with vitually no set-up time, which I can use anywhere. I use it to develop small fun projects, and to quickly play around with new ideas. I often drop these snippets in to my larger projects.
    Link: codepen.io/sbchewitt

  • Free Office

    In this project I included many more interactive elements, such as CSS hover effects and Javascript page scrolls. I also implemented the bxSlider jQuery module to display a series of images in a slider.Free Office is based on a PSD file of a corporate homepage layout.
    Link: sarahs.website/freeoffice

  • Greg Foot

    A freelance project to develop a web showcase for science presenter Greg Foot .The site was developed using Wordpress as the Content Management System. I used PHP to pull information and content from the back-end, then styled the elements using Sass, making sure everything looked great across a range of devices.
    Link: gregfoot.com

  • Retro Jam

    After learning the basics, Retro Jam was my first toe dipped into the web development ocean. A single page, based on a PSD file of a UI kit, I expanded my skills in HTML for page content, and CSS for styling and positioning the variety of elements (with a few jQuery UI elements thrown in for fun!).
    Link: sarahs.website/retrojam

ABOUT & CV

My name is Sarah Hewitt and I am a developer. I enjoy transforming a flat design into a dynamic website. I like creating unexpected elements and seeing people's positive reactions. I see coding problems as puzzles, puzzles that I can't help but solve. And I love to learn new skills, technical or not.

I have a degree in Chemistry and a PhD in Statistics. During my PhD I wrote many of my own programs in R in order to carry out my research. The satisfaction of writing my own working program inspired me to pursue a career in software development.

Currently I am employed as a QA Analyst, working in a small team to automate regression testing. I am in charge of the development and maintenance of our automation suite, which involves writing batch, Powershell and bash scripts to execute the automation, and modifying the C++ code of our internal tool that collates the automation results. I also investigate new technologies (such as Jenkins) that we might use to improve the automation.

DOWNLOAD CV (PDF)

It was during my work developing an HTML report of the regression test results that my interest in web development technologies was first piqued. To build on my basic knowledge I followed the web development courses on Codecademy. After completing the courses on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery and Angularjs I went on to practise and develop my skills further by seeking out my own projects, including a couple of freelance projects for paying clients. During these projects and beyond I have continued to pick up and develop new skills, such as responsive web design and Sass. You can see the results of these projects in the Work section, above.

When I'm not in front of a computer, some of the things I enjoy most are baking, sewing, reading, swimming and watching movies. I also like to spend as much time as possible outside when the weather is nice. You can find out more about me by visiting my Pinterest (I'm a little bit addicted) and Twitter pages.

CONTACT

If you would like to talk to me about a project or job vacancy you think might suit me, have any questions, or just want to say "Hi", please use the easy contact form on this page, or email me directly. I will get back to you as soon as I can.
